title: Cookies & Cache
intro: Dock 23. A missing shipment. A crew too nervous to go to the cops. That’s where I come in — one gumshoe against a tide of lies. I start where the trail goes cold: a forgotten dockhouse under cover of fog.

clues.text: A crowbar stashed beneath the dumpster outside. Someone wanted in without a key — and forgot their tool.
Tire tracks fresh in the dirt. A truck definitely left the dock, but what was in it?
Shipping terminal login screen waits inside. Nearby? A sticky note taped to the monitor — 'pass123'. Real secure, boys.
The scale logs don’t lie — that final truck left the warehouse nearly empty. Light as a feather, heavy with suspicion.
In the back office, a computer still logged in. Cookies saved from the last session. Someone forgot to wipe their secrets clean.
Emails confirm the worst: the guy in charge of the shipments? A rat. He's selling the guns to a rival crew for twice the price.
A photo on the desk with a date — turns out it's the password to the back office computer. Guess even crooks get nostalgic.

choices.prompt: You've got the evidence. Now what do you do?

options.text: Report back to your client — the DeadLock Crew.
options.result: The crew thanks you with a wad of cash and a silent nod. What they do with the info? Not your concern. But there will be blood.

options.text: Turn everything over to the cops.
options.result: You drop a tip from a payphone and vanish. The raid hits the next morning. Headlines scream of seizures and scandals.

options.text: Sell the info to a rival gang.
options.result: You name a price and walk away rich. The shipment never moves. The warehouse doesn’t survive the night.

tip: Even saved cookies can betray their owner. Never leave a logged-in session behind — it's like handing over your keys to a thief.
